summary:
For my whole professional life, I have been pursuing the career of a linguist in two aspects: a researcher, both academic and industrial in IT, and a writer. In the IT sphere, I have been working on computer-aided language learning, in particular on pronunciation training and text and speech processing. I am the head of the linguistic department in the IT company I’m working at and I am responsible for the linguistic architecture of all our language-related projects. Holding a PhD in Linguistics, I took part in research projects on formation of border identity and linguistic shifts in border zones.
This double focus helps me to enhance my writing skills ranging from technical description of IT products and award-winning articles on AI-related topics to academic papers.
